Detailed Description

The main drawing class.

Texture is used to draw a single texture onto the screen, via the GraphicsCore. The class is based off of code found in Jim Adams' Programming Role Playing Games with DirectX.

Member Function Documentation

BOOL Texture::Load ( GraphicsCore *  Graphics,
char *  FileName 
)

Loads a texture into m_Texture from file.

Parameters:
Graphics The GraphicsCore to which this texture is attached.
FileName Name of the image file to use.
Returns:
TRUE if the file is loaded properly.

float  DestY,
long  SrcX,
long  SrcY,
long  Width,
long  Height,
float  XScale,
float  YScale,
D3DCOLOR  Color,
D3DXVECTOR2 *  rotationCenter = NULL,
double  angle = 0.0f 
)

Blits a sprite to the screen.

This function should mostly only be called by Draw() in the Tile class. It renders any subset of the texture

Parameters:
DestX The x-coordinate to render the texture. This coordinate represents the top-left corner.
DestY The y-coordinate to render the texture. This coordinate represents the top-left corner.
SrcX The x-coordinate of the subset of the texture to render.
SrcY the y-coordinate of the subset of the texture to render.
Width the width of the subset to render.
Height the height of the subset to render.
XScale the scale with which to render the texture.
YScale the scale with which to render the texture.
Color the color to consider transparent in the texture.
Returns:
TRUE if the texture is drawn successfully.
